tweets.text: A year ago this week, 17 families in Parkland experienced the worst day of their lives. We are holding them in our prayers and we also must honor them by taking action—commonsense gun reform can prevent more worst days from becoming reality if we stand up to say enough is enough.

If you don't want to read that Esquire piece, you can instead read this big new piece from the @MiamiHerald and @teamtrace on the nearly 1,200 kids killed by gun violence in the year since the Parkland shooting https://t.co/hKSNyKkuab

Wow.

Teen journalists nationwide profiled 1,200 kids killed by gun violence since Parkland. 

Infants. Artists. Jokesters. Young parents. College-bound seniors. 

These are their stories, told by kids who worry they too will be touched by gun violence:
https://t.co/TQmQZXvAu2
